comment.author: 91829349@N00
comment._content: Looks like this guy, appointed Interstate Commerce Commissioner by Pres. Wilson in 1914. Interesting misspelling... en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Henry_Clay_Hall

comment.author: 70251312@N00
comment._content: Woodrow Wilson appointed Henry Clay Hall to the ICC (to fill a vacancy) on January 30, 1914. A New York native, Hall at that time was President of the Bar Association of Colorado. New York Times story, January 31, 1914: query.nytimes.com/mem/archive-free/pdf?res=9407E0DA1730E7... A New York Times story on February 6 reported that confirmation of Hall's appointment had been held up in a U. S. Senate committee: query.nytimes.com/mem/archive-free/pdf?res=9B06E4DE113FE6... The photo above is dated February 17, 1914: that's probably when Hall's appointment was confirmed by the Senate. The Bain Agency then circulated the photo to its subscribers.

comment.author: 23103743@N05
comment._content: www.old-picture.com/american-legacy/008/Henry-Clay-Hall-0... is another photo of the same man. Seems to confirm the identification by rjones0856

comment.author: 34904489@N07
comment._content:
All,

Thanks for your investigation into this misspelling.  Amazing the difference one letter can make!  We will make a fix to Bain's caption so Mr. Hall is properly identified. Thanks for the comments.
